Question: What are the official working hours?
Answer: Our standard working hours are 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM, Monday to Friday, with a 60-minute lunch break. Team-specific schedules may apply.

Question: Is there flexibility in working hours?
Answer: Flexible start/end windows may be available with manager approval. Record actual hours in the Attendance/Timesheet module.

Question: Do we have a work-from-home (wfh) policy?
Answer: Yes. Eligible roles may work remotely per the WFH policy. Coordinate with your manager and ensure availability during core hours.

Question: How do i mark my attendance?
Answer: Open the Attendance tab and use Check-In/Check-Out daily. Missed punches can be regularized with a short justification.

Question: What if i forget to mark attendance?
Answer: Submit an Attendance Regularization request for the affected date(s). Manager approval is required.

Question: How do i view the holiday calendar?
Answer: Go to HR Documents > Holiday Calendar to view region-specific public holidays for the current year.

Question: How do i apply for leave?
Answer: Go to Time Off > New Request, select a leave type (Annual/Sick/etc.), add dates and reason, then submit for approval.

Question: Can i cancel a leave request?
Answer: Yes. Pending or approved leaves can be withdrawn before the start date via Time Off > My Requests.

Question: Can i apply for a half-day leave?
Answer: Yes. Choose Half-Day while creating your request and select morning or afternoon session.

Question: What types of leave are available?
Answer: Typically Annual/Privilege Leave, Sick Leave, Casual Leave, and Unpaid Leave. Entitlements may vary by location.

Question: How many annual leaves do i get each year?
Answer: The standard entitlement is 20 days per year, prorated for new joiners. Check your balance in Time Off > My Balance.

Question: Can unused leave be carried forward?
Answer: A limited number of days (as per policy) can be carried forward to the next year. Excess balance may lapse.

Question: Is leave encashment allowed?
Answer: Encashment may be offered during year-end or separation, subject to policy and approval.

Question: Can i take leave during probation?
Answer: Yes, but it may be limited to Sick/Unpaid Leave unless otherwise approved by your manager.

Question: What is the sick leave documentation requirement?
Answer: For absences of 2 days or more, upload a medical certificate with your request.

Question: What is the maternity leave policy?
Answer: Eligible employees may avail maternity leave per local laws/policy. Upload required documents and notify HR.

Question: What is the paternity leave policy?
Answer: Eligible employees may take paternity leave as per policy. Apply via Time Off > New Request.

Question: How do i submit a resignation?
Answer: Go to Employee Profile > Resignation and submit your last working day with a brief reason. The workflow notifies your manager and HR.

Question: What is the notice period for resignation?
Answer: The standard notice period is 30 days. Any change requires written approval from your manager and HR.

Question: Can my notice period be waived or reduced?
Answer: Possible with manager recommendation and HR approval, depending on project handover and business needs.

Question: Can i withdraw my resignation?
Answer: You may request withdrawal before final approval. Manager and HR must both approve reinstatement.

Question: When will i receive full-and-final (f&f) settlement?
Answer: F&F is typically processed within 30–45 days after your last working day, subject to clearance of assets and dues.

Question: How do i get a relieving or experience letter?
Answer: After F&F completion, download letters from Employee Documents or request via HR Helpdesk.

Question: What is the process for asset return on exit?
Answer: Return laptop, ID card, and accessories to IT/Admin. Ensure the Exit Clearance form is signed to avoid delays in F&F.

Question: How do i download my payslip?
Answer: Go to Payroll > Payslips to view and download monthly statements in PDF format.

Question: When is salary credited?
Answer: Salary is usually credited on the last working day of the month. If it falls on a holiday/weekend, credit may occur on the prior business day.

Question: Whom do i contact for payroll discrepancies?
Answer: Raise a ticket to HR Payroll Helpdesk with your payslip and bank details. Most issues are resolved in the next cycle.

Question: How do i claim reimbursements?
Answer: Go to Expenses > New Claim, select category (travel/meal/etc.), upload receipts, and submit for approval.

Question: What is the receipt submission timeline for claims?
Answer: Submit expense receipts within 30 days of the transaction. Late submissions may be rejected.

Question: How do per-diem allowances work?
Answer: If applicable, per-diem rates are listed in the Travel Policy. Submit trips in advance for approval.

Question: Can i claim mileage for personal vehicle use?
Answer: Yes, if business related and pre-approved. Log distance, date, and purpose; reimbursement is per policy rates.

Question: How do i submit timesheets?
Answer: Go to Timesheets > Weekly, enter hours against projects/tasks, and submit before the cutoff time each week.

Question: Is overtime (ot) payable?
Answer: OT must be pre-approved. Eligible roles are compensated per policy, either as OT pay or compensatory off.

Question: Is there a night shift allowance?
Answer: Eligible shift employees may receive a night allowance as per location policy. See HR Docs > Shift Policy.

Question: How do i update my bank account?
Answer: Go to Profile > Payroll Settings > Bank Details. Some changes may require document upload and HR validation.

Question: How do i change my address or phone number?
Answer: Go to Profile > Personal Info > Edit, update details, and save. Changes reflect immediately in your profile.

Question: How do i update my emergency contact?
Answer: Open Profile > Emergency Contacts and add/update the contact name, relationship, and phone number.

Question: How do i correct my name on records?
Answer: Raise a request in HR Helpdesk with valid proof (e.g., government ID). HR will update after verification.

Question: How do i reset my password?
Answer: Click the ‘Forgot Password’ link on the login page. Check your registered email for the reset link (valid for 24 hours).

Question: What if the password reset link doesn’t work?
Answer: Try again after clearing browser cache or use a different browser. If it still fails, contact IT Helpdesk.

Question: My account is locked. what should i do?
Answer: Contact IT Helpdesk with your employee ID and registered email. Accounts typically unlock within 2 hours.

Question: How do i enable multi-factor authentication (mfa)?
Answer: Go to Security Settings > MFA and follow the setup steps using an authenticator app or SMS.

Question: How do i access vpn remotely?
Answer: Install the approved VPN client and sign in with your corporate credentials and MFA. See IT Docs > Remote Access.

Question: What is the policy on personal device (byod) use?
Answer: BYOD is allowed for email and calendar with MDM enrollment. Storing company data locally is restricted.

Question: What should i do if i lose my id card?
Answer: Report immediately to Admin/Facilities. A replacement can be issued; fees may apply as per policy.

Question: How do i report harassment or misconduct?
Answer: File a confidential report via the Ethics/Whistleblower channel or contact the POSH committee listed in HR Docs.

Question: Where can i find the code of conduct?
Answer: Open HR Documents > Code of Conduct for guidelines on professional behavior and compliance.

Question: How do i enroll in a training course?
Answer: Go to Learning > Catalog, search for a course, and click Enroll. You’ll receive a confirmation with schedule/details.

Question: Can i get reimbursement for certifications?
Answer: Yes, for approved certifications aligned with your role. Submit pre-approval and claim exam fees after passing.

Question: How do i request feedback for performance review?
Answer: In Performance > Feedback, select ‘Request Feedback’, choose reviewers, and send requests before the review deadline.

Question: When are performance reviews conducted?
Answer: A mid-year review occurs around June/July and the annual review around December/January, timelines may vary by BU.

Question: How do promotions and salary revisions work?
Answer: Promotions/salary changes are decided during annual review cycles based on performance, budget, and role expectations.

Question: When is variable pay/bonus paid?
Answer: Variable pay is typically paid after year-end closing, subject to performance ratings and company results.

Question: What is the employee referral policy?
Answer: Refer candidates via the Referral portal. Bonus is payable after the new hire completes the required tenure.

Question: How do i request an internal transfer?
Answer: Discuss with your manager and apply to open roles on the internal job board. HR will coordinate the process.

Question: What is the relocation assistance policy?
Answer: Eligible moves may include travel, temporary housing, and shipment support per policy with prior HR approval.

Question: How do i update tax declarations/investment proofs?
Answer: Go to Payroll > Tax Declarations to add investments and upload proofs during the declared window.

Question: Where can i download form 16 or annual tax statements?
Answer: Navigate to Payroll > Tax Documents to download Form 16/Year-end tax statements when published.

Question: What benefits are included in health insurance?
Answer: Coverage typically includes hospitalization, day-care procedures, and maternity benefits (limits apply). See Benefits > Insurance.

Question: How do i add or remove dependents from insurance?
Answer: Use Benefits > Dependents to add/remove and upload required documents during open enrollment or life events.

Question: What is the travel policy for airfare and lodging?
Answer: Book via the approved travel portal. Choose class and hotel grade as per band eligibility. Pre-approval is mandatory.

Question: Can i request an experience or employment verification letter?
Answer: Yes. Request an Employment Verification letter via HR Helpdesk. It is usually issued within 3–5 business days.

Question: What is the process for background verification (bgv)?
Answer: BGV is handled by an external partner. Provide requested documents promptly to avoid delays in onboarding or transitions.

Question: Can i take leave during the notice period?
Answer: Leave during notice period requires manager approval and may extend the last working day unless otherwise agreed.

Question: Is notice period buyout allowed?
Answer: Buyout may be considered based on policy, project needs, and HR approval. Financial terms apply if approved.

Question: How do i return company assets when working remotely?
Answer: Coordinate with IT/Admin for courier pickup or drop-off. Keep dispatch proof to avoid F&F delays.

Question: Where can i find all hr policies?
Answer: Go to HR Documents > Policies for the latest versions of Leave, Travel, Code of Conduct, WFH, and more.
